comment.shortText:
Adds a listener that will fire whenever the content of the user's clipboard changes. This method
is a no-op on Web.

Callback to execute when listener is triggered. The callback is provided a
single argument that is an object containing information about clipboard contents.

tags.text: Deprecated. Returns empty string. Use [`getStringAsync()`](#getstringasyncoptions) instead to retrieve clipboard content.

comment.shortText: An array of content types that are available on the clipboard.

A Base64-encoded string of the image data.
Its format is dependent on the `format` option.
comment.text:
> **NOTE:** The string is already prepended with `data:image/png;base64,` or `data:image/jpeg;base64,` prefix.

You can use it directly as the source of an `Image` element.

comment.shortText: Dimensions (`width` and `height`) of the image pasted from clipboard.
Type used to define what type of data is stored in the clipboard.

Gets the image from the user's clipboard and returns it in the specified format. Please note that calling
this method on web will prompt the user to grant your app permission to "see text and images copied to the clipboard."
comment.returns:
If there was an image in the clipboard, the promise resolves to
a [`ClipboardImage`](#clipboardimage) object containing the base64 string and metadata of the image.
Otherwise, it resolves to `null`.

comment.shortText: A `GetImageOptions` object to specify the desired format of the image.
The format of the clipboard image to be converted to.

Specify the quality of the returned image, between `0` and `1`. Defaults to `1` (highest quality).
Applicable only when `format` is set to `jpeg`, ignored otherwise.

Gets the content of the user's clipboard. Please note that calling this method on web will prompt
the user to grant your app permission to "see text and images copied to the clipboard."
comment.returns: A promise that resolves to the content of the clipboard.

comment.shortText: Options for the clipboard content to be retrieved.
The target format of the clipboard string to be converted to, if possible.
comment.text: On web, this option is ignored. The string is always returned without any conversion.

comment.shortText: Gets the url from the user's clipboard.
comment.returns: A promise that fulfills to the url in the clipboard.

comment.shortText: Returns whether the clipboard has a image content.
comment.text: On web, this requires the user to grant your app permission to _"see text and images copied to the clipboard"_.
comment.returns: A promise that fulfills to `true` if clipboard has image content, resolves to `false` otherwise.

comment.shortText: Returns whether the clipboard has text content.
comment.text: On web, this requires the user to grant your app permission to _"see text and images copied to the clipboard"_.
comment.returns: A promise that fulfills to `true` if clipboard has plain text content, resolves to `false` otherwise.

comment.shortText: Returns whether the clipboard has a URL content.
comment.returns: A promise that fulfills to `true` if clipboard has URL content, resolves to `false` otherwise.

comment.shortText: Removes the listener added by addClipboardListener. This method is a no-op on Web.
The subscription to remove (created by addClipboardListener).
Sets an image in the user's clipboard.
Image encoded as a base64 string, without mime type.
Sets the content of the user's clipboard.
comment.returns:
On web, this returns a boolean value indicating whether or not the string was saved to
the user's clipboard. On iOS and Android, nothing is returned.

comment.shortText: Sets the content of the user's clipboard.
comment.returns:
On web, this returns a promise that fulfills to a boolean value indicating whether or not
the string was saved to the user's clipboard. On iOS and Android, the promise always resolves to `true`.

comment.shortText: The string to save to the clipboard.
Options for the clipboard content to be set.

The input format of the provided string.
Adjusting this option can help other applications interpret copied string properly.
comment.text: On web, this option is ignored. The string will be copied directly as-is, without any conversion.

comment.shortText: Sets a url in the user's clipboard.
The url to save to the clipboard.
Type used to determine string format stored in the clipboard.
A method to unsubscribe the listener.
